This week in 1947 the TV legend and pin-up idol was born in Corpus Christi. We're looking back at pictures of the late celeb through the years.

(Photo by ABC Photo Archives/ABC via Getty Images)

less "Angels in Chains" - Season 1 - 10/26/76. Undercover detectives Kelly Garrett (Jaclyn Smith, left), Jill Munroe (Farrah Fawcett-Majors, center) and Sabrina Duncan (Kate Jackson) are planted in a corrupt
... more Photo: ABC Photo Archives/ABC Via Getty Images Image 78 of 78 Remembering Farrah Fawcett on the 70th anniversary of her birth 1 / 78 Back to Gallery This week we are remembering late TV legend and blonde bombshell Farrah Fawcett, who was born this week 70 years ago in Corpus Christi.
Fawcett died on June 25, 2009 at the age of 62 after fighting cancer for nearly three years. She left behind her partner, actor Ryan O’Neal, and one son they had together in 1985.
WOW!: Farrah Fawcett inspired ‘Midnight Train to Georgia’
Known for her bubbly spirit, blonde mane, and pin-up model beauty, Fawcett was one of the most beloved TV stars of the ‘70s and ‘80s for her role on “Charlie’s Angels” where the world first met her.
The famous poster of Fawcett in a tight red bikini sold nearly 12 million copies when it was released in 1976.
HELLO ANGELS: 40 years ago this week America said hello to 'Charlie's Angels'
She showed the world a different side of herself when she starred in the 1984 TV movie “The Burning Bed” about domestic violence. She also starred in "Logan's Run", "Saturn 3", "The Cannonball Run", "The Apostle", and "Dr. T and the Women".
Her giving soul lives on with the Farrah Fawcett Foundation , which she started in 2007 just after her cancer diagnosis. The foundation focuses on cancer research and alternative treatments.
